comment.author: 43688219@N00
comment._content: There does not appear to be a Medal Index card listed at the National Archive for an S E Bellew serving in any unit.There appear to be cards for at least 7 soldiers with the surname Bellew who served in the Royal Field Artillery accoring to their MIC listings - including a George E Bellew - discovery.nationalarchives.gov.uk/SearchUI/Details?uri=D1... Possibly a transcription error? Or maybe he didn't serve in a Theatre of War so didn't qualify for any medals. No match on the Commonwealth War Graves Commission site. There are 127 individuals with the surname Bellew recorded on the 1911 census for England and Wales, of which two have S first names - both Sidney, and there are no S.E's. Of course our man may have come from Scotland, Ireland or somewhere even more exotic :-)

comment.author: 8952180@N05
comment._content: I've had a look at the medal card and it is for a "George E Bellew", a Driver with the RFA. The card lists three regimental numbers: 1018, 930024, 296474. So far I've been unable to find any record of a "S E Bellew" in the RFA. Is there a chance that the name attributed to this photo is incorrect and that it is in fact "G E Bellew"?

comment.author: 8952180@N05
comment._content: A capitalized cursive "G" could easily be mistaken for a cursive "S".

comment.author: 62508825@N00
comment._content: Assuming the person we are looking for is G E Bellew: George Edward Bellew (his father?) married 4th qr 1878 in Horncastle No birth date around 1880 found for George E Bellew George E Bellew married Violet L Gammon in 3rd qr 1920 in Marylebone Offspring of Bellew and Gammon are: Births 1st qr 1921 Richard G Eton 2nd qr 1926 Gordon E Newport M 1st qr 1935 Joyce P Pontypool 2nd qr 1938 Geoffrey C Eton George E Bellew died 2nd qr 1935 age 55 Manchester S. Source: FreeBMD www.freebmd.org.uk Medal card Bellew, George E Corps: Royal Field Artillery Regiment No: 1018 Trooper discovery.nationalarchives.gov.uk/SearchUI/Details?uri=D1...

comment.author: 62508825@N00
comment._content: 1881 Census gives George E Bellew born c1852 in Kent Surgeon Dentist resides in Newbury Berks 1901 Census gives George E Bellew born c1887 in Lancs resides in Lancs and Geo Edwd Bellew born c1898 in Ireland resides in Kent 1911 Census gives George Edward Bellew born c.1852 born at sea resides in Essex www.ancestry.co.uk I don't have a subscription - maybe someone can flesh this out.

comment.author: 43688219@N00
comment._content: I was going to wait for the good people at IWM to come back with confirmation one way or t'other :-), before adding anything more about George from the census.
